validationRules.beforeImg: Required - Must have valid url property for before image
validationRules.afterImg: Required - Must have valid url property for after image
validationRules.sepWidth: Must be numeric string (e.g., '3', '5', '8') for separator line width in pixels
validationRules.sepPosi: Optional - String '0' to '100' for default separator position percentage
validationRules.onmouseHvr: Boolean - true for hover activation, false for drag-only
validationRules.sepLine: Boolean - true to show full-height separator line
validationRules.fullWidth: Boolean - true to expand to full container width
validationRules.labelTypo.openTypography: Must be 1 to enable typography controls
validationRules.labelBgtype.openBg: Must be 1 to enable background styling
validationRules.labelBorder.openBorder: Must be 1 to enable border styling
validationRules.labelBshadow.openShadow: Must be 1 to enable box shadow
validationRules.sepColor: Hex color code for separator line (e.g., '#ffffff', '#667eea')
validationRules.sepbotColor: Optional - Hex color for bottom segment of separator (creates two-tone effect)
validationRules.sepIcon: Optional - Custom separator handle image object with url property
validationRules.alignment: Responsive object with md/sm/xs breakpoints for left/center/right alignment

warnings: ⚠️ Both beforeImg and afterImg must have the same aspect ratio for smooth comparison
⚠️ Images should be optimized for web (compressed) to ensure fast loading
⚠️ Use same imageSize for both before/after to maintain consistent dimensions
⚠️ sepPosi value (0-100) determines default slider position: 0=all before, 50=middle, 100=all after
⚠️ sepbotColor creates two-tone separator only when sepLine is true
⚠️ Custom sepIcon should be transparent PNG, sized around 40-60px for best results
⚠️ onmouseHvr:false creates drag-only interaction (better for mobile, more intentional on desktop)
⚠️ Labels may overlap images on small screens - test responsive breakpoints
⚠️ sepStyle 'top' or 'bottom' positions may be less intuitive for users than 'middle'
⚠️ Vertical sliders work best with portrait-oriented images
⚠️ Horizontal sliders work best with landscape-oriented images
⚠️ fullWidth:true may cause layout issues if parent container has constraints
⚠️ Very thin separator lines (sepWidth < 2) may be hard to see on some displays
⚠️ Gradient backgrounds (labelBgtype with bgGradient) require openBg:1 and bgType:'gradient'
⚠️ Label styling (typography, background, border, shadow) requires respective 'open' flags set to 1
⚠️ Mobile users may find drag interaction challenging - consider onmouseHvr:true for better UX
commonMistakes: ❌ Using different aspect ratios for before/after images (causes distortion)
❌ Forgetting to set openTypography:1 before applying labelTypo settings
❌ Setting sepbotColor without enabling sepLine:true (no visible effect)
❌ Using very large uncompressed images (causes slow loading and poor UX)
❌ Placing labels without padding (text touches edges, looks cramped)
❌ Using low-contrast label colors that blend with image content
❌ Setting sepPosi too extreme (0 or 100) hiding one side completely on load
❌ Not testing on mobile devices where drag interactions may be difficult
❌ Using custom sepIcon without transparent background (looks clunky)
❌ Forgetting to set imageSize consistently (one image loads full, other loads thumbnail)
❌ Applying labelBorder without setting openBorder:1 (no border appears)
❌ Using vertical slider with very wide landscape images (poor visual balance)
❌ Not providing beforeLabel/afterLabel (users don't know which side is which)
❌ Setting fullWidth:true inside narrow containers (stretches images awkwardly)
❌ Using serif fonts for labels in modern/tech contexts (style mismatch)
bestPractices: ✅ Use images with identical dimensions and aspect ratios for seamless comparison
✅ Compress and optimize images before upload (use WebP format for best performance)
✅ Set sepPosi to strategic value: 50 for neutral, 30-40 to show more 'after', 60-70 to show more 'before'
✅ Use onmouseHvr:true for easier mobile interaction and better discoverability
✅ Add clear, concise labels ('Before/After', 'Old/New', dates, version numbers)
✅ Choose sepStyle:'middle' for most intuitive user interaction
✅ Use sufficient label padding (8-16px) for comfortable reading
✅ Ensure label colors have high contrast against background (WCAG AA minimum)
✅ Test on multiple devices and screen sizes, especially mobile
✅ Use semi-transparent label backgrounds (rgba with 0.7-0.9 alpha) to avoid hiding image content
✅ Match separator color to site branding or image color palette
✅ Use sepWidth 3-6px for good visibility without being intrusive
✅ For professional/corporate sites, use subtle styling; for creative portfolios, use bold colors/gradients
✅ Add box shadows to labels for better separation from images
✅ Use responsive typography (different fontSize for md/sm/xs) for label readability
✅ Consider accessibility - provide alt text on images, ensure keyboard navigation works
✅ Use horizontal sliders for landscape images, vertical for portraits
✅ Start with sepPosi:50 unless you have strategic reason to bias one side
✅ Use fullWidth:true for hero sections, false for content-width sections
✅ Test with realistic content images (not just placeholders) before publishing

horizontal.bestFor: Landscape images, wide-format photos, website screenshots, architectural exteriors, panoramas
horizontal.userExpectation: Most common pattern, users instinctively understand left=before, right=after
horizontal.mobileConsideration: Works well on all orientations, natural swipe gesture

vertical.bestFor: Portrait images, full-body photos, tall buildings, infographics, mobile screenshots
vertical.userExpectation: Less common, may need clearer labels to indicate top=before, bottom=after
vertical.mobileConsideration: Better for portrait-oriented mobile screens, natural scroll gesture

middle.bestFor: Most use cases, balanced design, easy to grab
middle.interaction: Intuitive, users naturally grab center handle

top.description: Handle at top of separator line
top.bestFor: When bottom area has important content, minimalist designs
top.interaction: Less common, may be less discoverable

bottom.description: Handle at bottom of separator line
bottom.bestFor: When top area has important content, footer-aligned designs

hover.description: Slider follows mouse position on hover
hover.pros: More discoverable, easier on mobile (tap to activate), immediate visual feedback
hover.cons: Can be distracting if user hovers unintentionally
hover.bestFor: General audience, mobile-friendly sites, quick comparisons

dragOnly.description: User must click/tap and drag separator
dragOnly.pros: More intentional interaction, less accidental activation, precise control
dragOnly.cons: Less discoverable, may be harder on mobile, requires instruction
dragOnly.bestFor: Professional portfolios, detailed comparisons requiring precision, desktop-focused audiences

accessibilityNotes: ♿ Provide descriptive alt text on both beforeImg and afterImg (handled by WordPress media library)
♿ Ensure label text has sufficient contrast against background (WCAG AA: 4.5:1 minimum)
♿ Use semantic label text ('Before/After', dates, version numbers) for screen readers
♿ Enable keyboard navigation - users should be able to drag separator with keyboard (depends on block implementation)
♿ Avoid relying solely on color to differentiate before/after - use labels
♿ Consider users with motion sensitivity - static comparisons may be preferable to auto-animations (this block has no auto-animation, good)
♿ Test with screen readers to ensure image descriptions are announced correctly
♿ Provide visual affordance (separator handle) that's large enough to click/tap (minimum 44x44px touch target)
♿ Use aria-label attributes on interactive elements (if implementing custom controls)
♿ Ensure focus states are visible when navigating with keyboard
performanceConsiderations: ⚡ Optimize images before upload - use compression tools (TinyPNG, ImageOptim, Squoosh)
⚡ Use appropriate imageSize - don't load 'full' resolution if displaying small (use 'large' or 'medium_large')
⚡ Consider lazy loading for below-fold before/after blocks (WordPress lazy-loading handles this automatically for img tags)
⚡ Use WebP format with JPEG fallback for best compression and browser support
⚡ Ensure both images are similar file size - large disparity can cause layout shift
⚡ Avoid very large separator line widths (sepWidth > 10) which may cause rendering overhead
⚡ Minimize use of complex gradients with many color stops in labelBgtype
⚡ Use CSS transforms for separator animation (hardware-accelerated) rather than position changes
⚡ Test on slow 3G networks to ensure images load reasonably fast
⚡ Consider using srcset/responsive images for different screen sizes (WordPress handles this automatically)
